title: Atletico Madrid president warns clubs off 'world football star' Antoine Griezmann and coach Diego Simeone
title_page: Atletico Madrid president warns clubs off 'world football star' Antoine Griezmann and coach Diego Simeone | Daily Mail Online
text:
Praises the 'winning culture' that Simeone has brought to the club
Atletico Madrid president Enrique Cerezo has hailed Antoine Griezmann as a star of world football and maintained that coach Diego Simeone has a long-term future at the club.
The French forward has been in stunning form for the Spaniards, with his 19 goals in all competitions spearheading a serious title challenge from the 2014 La Liga champions.
Simeone's men have taken 48 points from their opening 21 games and lie second in the table, behind leaders Barcelona on goal difference.
Antoine Griezmann has been in sparkling form for Atletico Madrid this year scoring 19 goals across the board
Atletico president Enrique Cerezo has hailed Diego Simeone for bringing a 'winning culture' to the club
DIEGO SIMEONE TROPHY HAUL Europa League 2011-12 UEFA Super Cup 2012 Copa del Rey 2012-13 La Liga 2013-14 Spanish Super Cup 2014
And with the 24-year-old attracting the interest of top clubs from across the continent, the Atletico president has insisted his future remains at the Calderon.
'Griezmann is a global football star,' Cerezo told RMC .
'Griezmann has a long-term contract, and no-one has spoken to us about a possible transfer.
'He is a world football star and he still has plenty of time with us.'
Cerezo described Griezmann as a 'global football star' and believes his long-term future lies at the Calderon
Cerezo went on to insist that coach Simeone, who has won five trophies since taking over in December 2011, will continue his career in the Spanish capital.
'We have a coach who has a winning culture,' he said. 'Simeone has offered us come incredible years.
'The mood of everyone is that Diego continues with us.'
